metadata.Title: CVE-2020-15803 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Zabbix before 3.0.32rc1, 4.x before 4.0.22rc1, 4.1.x through 4.4.x before 4.4.10rc1, and 5.x before 5.0.2rc1 allows stored XSS in the URL Widget. It was discovered that Zabbix did not properly validate input. A remote attacker could exploit this to conduct cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-15803` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

zabbix-agent - 1:5.0.2+dfsg-1
zabbix-frontend-php - 1:5.0.2+dfsg-1
zabbix-java-gateway - 1:5.0.2+dfsg-1
zabbix-proxy-mysql - 1:5.0.2+dfsg-1
zabbix-proxy-pgsql - 1:5.0.2+dfsg-1
zabbix-proxy-sqlite3 - 1:5.0.2+dfsg-1
zabbix-server-mysql - 1:5.0.2+dfsg-1
zabbix-server-pgsql - 1:5.0.2+dfsg-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: zabbix package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:5.0.2+dfsg-1').
